programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.desc: Facing a desk job, baby-faced Hansons only other option is to go back to high school - as an undercover cop.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 America, What A Town
programme.desc: Hanson and Penhall infiltrate a stolen car ring operating out of a high school auto shop.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 Dont Pet The Teacher
programme.desc: Officer Hanson falls for his English teacher, whos also the object of others desires.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 My Futures So Bright, I Gotta Wear Shades
programme.desc: A girls death forces Officers Hanson and Penhall to go undercover at the exclusive West Chadway Prep School.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 The Worst Night Of Your Life
programme.desc: A pyromaniac at an all-girl school has undercover cop Judy Hoffs blazing a trail - to a prom-night inferno.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.sub-title: S01 : E07 Gotta Finish The Riff
programme.desc: Following his death, Captain Jenkos replacement leads the squad to the rescue of a school held hostage.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.desc: A 16-year-old turns tricks for home security codes, leading Ioki on a trail of burglary and prostitution.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.desc: A sexually abused coed tries to hire Jump Streets Officer Hanson to kill her policeman father.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.desc: Hanson is after a student loan shark, but risks his cover when his quiz team heads to the televised finals.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.sub-title: S01 : E11 Low And Away / Running On Ice
programme.desc: Penhall goes undercover as a high school baseball jock to protect the schools pitching ace, a mobsters son.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.desc: Penhall and Hoffs investigate a teenage modeling agency to arrest the leaders of a high school porno ring.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.sub-title: S01 : E13 Mean Streets And Pastel Houses
programme.desc: Hanson goes "punk" to infiltrate rival gangs in an attempt to halt their destruction and rescue one member.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.sub-title: S02 : E01 In The Custody Of A Clown
programme.desc: The Jump Street team goes undercover to investigate a suspected kidnapper Edison Coulter.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.desc: A sixteen-year-old crack dealer is mysteriously murdered in the seedy world of narcotics and prostitution.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.desc: After a wave of crack-related deaths, Penhall suspects that a hired outside police expert is responsible.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.sub-title: S02 : E04 Two For The Road
programme.desc: The Jump Street squad puts a sting on a bar and cope with the drunk driving arrest of their own captain.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.desc: Fuller and Hoffs go undercover at a violent high school where both student and faculty carry lethal weapons.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.desc: loki faces a paternity suit and jail when a teen fingers him as the father of her child.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.sub-title: S02 : E07 Dont Stretch The Rainbow
programme.desc: Hanson and Hoffs try to diffuse the potentially explosive situation in the racially divided Burgard High.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.desc: Hanson, Penhall, and loki investigate a rash of brutal assaults on gay men.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.sub-title: S02 : E09 You Ought To Be In Prison
programme.desc: Officer Hanson is kidnapped endangering his life, and that of a Hollywood heartthrob he was sent to protect.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.sub-title: S02 : E10 How Much Is That Body In The Window?
programme.desc: When a gymnast dies of a steroid overdose, Penhall and Hoffs go undercover to discover the source.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.desc: Officer loki is faced with immediate dismissal from the Chapel when hes uncovered as a Vietnamese refugee.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.sub-title: S02 : E12 Fear And Loathing With Russell Buckins / Dont The Quarter Mile In A Lifetime
programme.desc: Officer Hanson experiences a late teenage rebellion, putting his friendships and his future in jeopardy.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.sub-title: S02 : E13 A Big Disease With A Little Name
programme.desc: Frustratingly helpless in a case he cant solve, Hanson befriends a teen AIDS patient he is asked to protect.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.desc: On Valentines Day the Jump Street squad plays poker and reminisces about their worst dates.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.sub-title: S02 : E15 Im OK, You Need Work
programme.desc: Hansons trapped in an adolescent abuse center when he goes to investigate reports of patient mistreatment.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.sub-title: S02 : E16 Orpheus 3.3 / The Convenience Killer
programme.desc: Hanson stalks a ruthless killer to avenge the cold-blooded murder of his girlfriend.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.desc: Hanson and Penhall pose as battling brothers to infiltrate a gang of kids from the wrong side of the tracks.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.sub-title: S02 : E18 Brother Hanson and The Miracle Of Renners Pond
programme.desc: Hanson poses as a bible thumping student and befriends a teen whose strong faith almost costs him his life.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.desc: The Jump Street gang may lose Judy Hoffs when she falls for a guy on the wrong side of the law.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.sub-title: S02 : E20 Best Years Of Your Life
programme.desc: Penhall recounts painful memories of his mothers suicide when a youth hes investigating takes his own life.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.sub-title: S02 : E21 Cory And Dean Got Married
programme.desc: When a young murderer and his bride are busted at their wedding, a desperate groom takes Hoffs hostage.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.desc: The Jump Street cops must find temporary jobs when schools out for summer, and maybe forever.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.desc: Hanson comes to blows with a new partner whom he suspects is as bigoted as the racists theyre investigating.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.sub-title: S03 : E02 Slippin Into Darkness / Date With An Angel
programme.desc: Hanson and Booker try to catch a drug dealer--impeded by vigilantes committed to clean the streets of crime.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.sub-title: S03 : E03 The Currency We Trade In
programme.desc: Penhall must help a falsely accused child molester overcome the devastation of the false charge.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.sub-title: S03 : E04 Coach Of The Year
programme.desc: Penhall and Booker join an all-state football team to investigate negligence on the part of the coach.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.sub-title: S03 : E05 Whose Choice Is It Anyways?
programme.desc: The Jump Street team goes undercover to find out who has been vandalizing pregnancy clinics.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.desc: Jump Street goes undercover on a college campus to investigate a rape on fraternity row.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.sub-title: S03 : E07 The Dragon And The Angel
programme.desc: loki infiltrates a gang and offered a chance to contact his grandma who was left in Vietnam after the war.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.desc: When the police union strikes, the Jump Street cops are torn over which side of the picket line to choose.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.desc: The Jump Street crew pose as inmates in juvenile lock-up to learn how heroin is entering the facility.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.desc: Hoffs learns her new lover is married and when she tries to break up, he sexually harasses her.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.desc: While trying to infiltrate a high school computer club, Penhall is picked on by a bully.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.sub-title: S03 : E12 The Dreaded Return Of Russell Buckins
programme.desc: When a revealing magazine article about the Jump Street program is written, Hanson is suspended.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.desc: Penhall and Hanson must bring a young private back to the Army base before hes charged with desertion.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.desc: Booker feels guilty knowing an innocent student has been killed because his friends mistook him for a narc.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.desc: The team is on the verge of busting his son for drug dealing when the mayor steps in and suspends Fuller.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.desc: When drug-dealing gets out of hand at a prestigious performing arts school, the team must join the act.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.sub-title: S03 : E17 Blinded By The Thousand Points Of Light
programme.desc: The Jump Street cops go undercover on the streets as homeless runaways to find a missing teenager.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.desc: When the controversial host of a radio show is nearly killed, Booker takes over to flush out the guilty party.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.sub-title: S03 : E19 Locd Out, Part 1 / Partners, Part 1
programme.desc: When Hanson and loki go undercover with two rival gangs to find their weapons supplier, loki is shot.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.sub-title: S03 : E20 Locd Out, Part 2 / Partners, Part 2
programme.desc: Forensics proves a third gun was fired the night Tower was killed, but a jury finds Hanson guilty of murder.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.desc: While in the process of clearing Hanson of all charges, Booker is forced to resign.

programme.title: mareTV: In Alaskas Fjord World
programme.desc: Gigantic fjords and over 5,000 small islands: In Alaskas south theres a lot of wilderness and little civilization. The region between the capital Juneau and the Canadian border is also known by locals as the "Last Frontier", the last outpost. Michelle Masden, for example, has come to terms with the harsh conditions here. She is the only seaplane pilot in the region. She earns her living with her 65-year-old Beaver: as an air taxi, transport plane and now and then as a rescuer in last necessity. Michelle flies anything and everything: spare parts and food, doctors, hikers and hunters. For the fishermen of southern Alaska she searches for large shoals of fish and guides the captains to...

programme.title: Asia - Secret Lives Hidden Places II
programme.sub-title: S02 : E04 Asia - Secret Lives Hidden Places II: Gaoligongshan Park: China – Himalaya’s Gold
programme.desc: The Great Gobi National Park in southwestern Mongolia shelters one of the last populations of wild Bactrian camels, amid its ancient and mysterious desert landscape. With around 800 critically endangered animals, the Gobi remains one of the worlds most sparsely inhabited and inhospitable regions, yet its allure is undeniable, offering a captivating backdrop for encounters with wild camels and stories of people deeply connected to nature.

programme.title: Asia - Secret Lives Hidden Places II
programme.sub-title: S02 : E05 Asia - Secret Lives Hidden Places II: Great Gobi National Park: Mongolia – Following the Wild Camels
programme.desc: The jungle in northern Vietnam is nearly impenetrable, with some areas never touched by humans. The remote rainforests of Pu Mat National Park serve as a refuge for endangered wildlife such as black bears, monkeys, and pangolins. Tuan, a biologist and bear specialist, embarks on an expedition to these untouched regions of the park in search of bears. The most hunted animal here is the pangolin, sought after for its scales believed to have medicinal properties and its meat considered a delicacy. A small Vietnamese conservation organization fights for the survival of this species.

programme.title: The Secret world of Herbs
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 The Secret World of Herbs - In Provence
programme.desc: Its native fragrant flowers and aromatic herbs have made the Provence a brand known worldwide. The wealth of flora found in this region, between the French Alps and the Mediterranean, is unequalled among the French provinces. Around Sault, near Mont Ventoux, the valleys and high plains are carpeted with bright violet: In the hot climate of the South of France, lavender blooms and exudes its fragrance. Monastic healers have been using its aromatic medicinal oil since the Middle Ages. And today an entire industry is based on the trade with this fragrant flower. Yet the livelihood of Provençal lavender farmers is imperiled. In France’s major lavender-growing region, the “Plateau de...

programme.title: The Secret world of Herbs
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 The Secret World of Herbs - In India
programme.desc: In India, herbs play an everyday role hardly equalled anywhere in the world. From the tropical green south to the mountains of the northern Himalayas, herbs lend fragrance to joss sticks and soaps, and flavor to the cuisine. And, above all, herbs heal. Six thousand varieties of plants are used in India, and most are harvested in the wild – where they are becoming depleted. The ever rising need for herbal medicine for the subcontinent’s 1.3 billion inhabitants comes on top of the demand of its growing middle class for herbal-based cosmetics. As a result, certain herbs have become scarce, while others have already vanished entirely. Most of the herbs in India are harvested in the wild. The...

programme.title: The Secret world of Herbs
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 The Secret World of Herbs - In Latin America
programme.desc: Healing effects, fragrance, and intense flavor – the benefits of herbs were discovered by the indigenous peoples of South America long before Spanish conquistadores subdued the continent. Even today, in the remote regions of South America, life without herbs is unthinkable. For many inhabitants, they provide the sole medicine. For more than two thousand years, this wisdom of the healing powers of nature has been passed down from generation to generation. In Bolivia, the film accompanies ethnobiologist Rainer Bussmann on one of his expeditions documenting which herbs the locals use against which illnesses. The German scientist has spent the last 15 years in the region, focussed on...

programme.title: The Secret world of Herbs
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 The Secret World of Herbs - In the Alps
programme.desc: Secluded for many centuries in inaccessible valleys, the inhabitants of the Alps had no alternative but to rely on the healing powers of nature. A knowledge of herbs was deeply rooted in these mountain-dwellers’ everyday lives – until the twentieth century, when this wisdom became eclipsed by modern academic medicine. Today, Alpine herbs are witnessing a revival, as public interest in regional natural treasures grows. The potential of Alpine herbs is far from exhausted. In the Berchtesgaden Alps, the film shows Hubsi Ilsanker at work as a root-digger, a back-breaking job that has scarcely changed in four hundred years. Authorized by a special historic permit to supply the oldest gentian...

programme.title: The Secret world of Herbs
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 The Secret world of Herbs - In the Balkans
programme.desc: In the pristine nature and mild climate of southeastern Europe grows a unique diversity of wild plants. Far removed from major industry and polluted soils, the Balkan countries have become the largest exporter of herbs in Europe. In Bulgaria alone, more than 300,000 people work with domestic plants. The business is becoming increasingly lucrative. The film takes us to the Croatian coast. On the Adriatic island of Cres, the audience meets Mladen Dragoslavić. In May, when the sage begins to blossom, this beekeeper has one month to produce his income for an entire year – always with the goal of creating the best sage honey in the Balkans. Given a choice, the bees would never choose sage, for...

programme.title: 15th Meridian East - Similarity in Difference
programme.desc: What ideas are people on the 15th meridian east developing to shape the future and leave tomorrows generations a home worth living in? This consequence leads us to four future designers. From the barren Namib Desert to the glacier worlds of Spitsbergen, Sicily and the Croatian Mediterranean.

programme.title: 15th Meridian East - Similarity in Difference
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 From Generation to Generation
programme.desc: The journey leads from the Norwegian Vesterålen to Chad, the Aeolian Islands and the Polish Giant Mountains. As different as the landscapes and cultures may be, all people are united in their love for their children and their desire to give something to tomorrows generation.

programme.title: 15th Meridian East - Similarity in Difference
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Sow, Harvest, Eat – Our Conservatory
programme.desc: This episode focuses on people from five countries who share a common passion: The production of their own food and food. What culinary treasures are hidden in the different regions, from Spitsbergen to Sweden, Austria, Poland and Chad?

programme.title: 15th Meridian East - Similarity in Difference
programme.desc: Almost 11000 kilometres lie between the northernmost and southernmost point of the 15th meridian east. Here you will find extreme landscapes such as the shimmering heat of Africa or the eternal cold of northern Scandinavia. Five people from Spitsbergen, Namibia, Slovenia, Germany and Poland dedicate their lives to environmental protection.

programme.title: 15th Meridian East - Similarity in Difference
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Wild Life, Gentle Nature
programme.desc: As contrasting as the landscapes of the 15th meridian east, so different are its animal inhabitants. What are the living conditions like in the heat of the Namibian Damaraland, in Lusatia or on the coast of Norway? Which challenges do elephants, whales or kingfishers have to master together with their companions from north to south?

programme.title: Asia - Secret Lives Hidden Places II
programme.sub-title: S02 : E01 Asia - Secret Lives Hidden Places II: Gir National Park: India – Asia’s Last Lion
programme.desc: In the far west of India, unexpected predators roam: lions. Living freely in a human-inhabited area without fences, they occasionally prey on the livestock of the indigenous Maldhari people, who nevertheless take pride in sharing their region with these lions—a unique coexistence of humans and predators. In northern Gujarat, desert landscapes dominate, where semi-nomadic communities breed a unique camel breed capable of swimming: Karai camels swim up to 3km daily to mangrove islands for grazing.

programme.title: Asia - Secret Lives Hidden Places II
programme.sub-title: S02 : E02 Asia - Secret Lives Hidden Places II: Kinabatangan River: Borneo – Forgotten Paradise
programme.desc: In Sabah, northern Borneo, flows the 560km-long Kinabatangan River. Nowhere else in Sabah are wild animals as easily spotted as along this river: orangutans, elephants, crocodiles, and proboscis monkeys. However, biodiversity is threatened as more rainforest gives way to palm oil plantations. Wildlife ventures into inhabited areas in search of food, leading to conflicts. Locals are fighting to preserve the rainforest and its unique wildlife, demonstrating that conservation and prosperity can coexist even in a modern society.

programme.title: Asia - Secret Lives Hidden Places II
programme.sub-title: S02 : E03 Asia - Secret Lives Hidden Places II: Pu Mat National Park: Vietnam – Of Bears and Men
programme.desc: The jungle in northern Vietnam is nearly impenetrable, with some areas never touched by humans. The remote rainforests of Pu Mat National Park serve as a refuge for endangered wildlife such as black bears, monkeys, and pangolins. Tuan, a biologist and bear specialist, embarks on an expedition to these untouched regions of the park in search of bears. The most hunted animal here is the pangolin, sought after for its scales believed to have medicinal properties and its meat considered a delicacy. A small Vietnamese conservation organization fights for the survival of this species.

programme.title: Asia - Secret Lives Hidden Places II
programme.sub-title: S02 : E04 Asia - Secret Lives Hidden Places II: Gaoligongshan Park: China – Himalaya’s Gold
programme.desc: The Great Gobi National Park in southwestern Mongolia shelters one of the last populations of wild Bactrian camels, amid its ancient and mysterious desert landscape. With around 800 critically endangered animals, the Gobi remains one of the worlds most sparsely inhabited and inhospitable regions, yet its allure is undeniable, offering a captivating backdrop for encounters with wild camels and stories of people deeply connected to nature.

programme.title: Wildlife Diaries Australia
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 Of Fairy Penguins and GPS Trackers
programme.desc: Australias largest fur seal colony is located on Phillip Island. Night after night, a breathtaking spectacle takes place here: At sunset, countless fairy penguins return from their hunt for fish. In the station near the penguin colony, pioneering scientific research is conducted around the cute animals. We learn how dedicated scientists are trying to secure the future of the fairy penguins with the help of GPS trackers.

programme.title: Beak and Brain - Genius Birds from Down Under
programme.desc: These child prodigies of the animal kingdom have feathers and beaks – and very special skills! The Keas of New Zealand are the only parrots that live in snowy mountain areas. They like testing their brains, solving puzzles and challenging tourists: they unscrew bottle-tops, dismantle windscreen wiper blades and tear open rucksacks. They seem so determined you’d think they have an understanding of physics and mechanics! Thousands of miles northwards, in New Caledonia, other birds have talent, too. Here bird expert Gavin Hunt discovered that crows are able to produce a whole set of tools, each designed for a particular purpose – the most intricate tool culture in the animal kingdom! These...

programme.title: Symphony of the Seas - Underwater Wonders of Australias Ocean
programme.desc: Our journeys take us all around the world from Patagonia to the USA, from Greenland to South Africa and from Cambodia to Australia and leads us to the most fascinating places where landscapes animals and humans are the main focus of our documentaries. Whether on land or at sea – the last paradises of the world are our destination.

programme.title: Wild Moments
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Wild Moments: Dangerous and Deadly I
programme.desc: Wildlife film-makers often risk life and limb trying to capture unique images of their dangerous protagonists. In Alaska a cunning grizzly threatens the son of Andreas Kieling, on the remote Wrangel Island in northern-east Siberia his colleague Uwe Anders is taken by surprise by a a polar bear, and off the coast of South Africa a diving-team is unexpectedly surrounded by white sharks. But the life of the film-makers is also threatened by elemental forces, life-threatening diseases and failing technical equipment: Deep in the vast rainforests of West Africa cameraman Klaus Scheurich nearly dies of malaria, and in South India a film team narrowly escapes death in a hot-air balloon accident....

programme.title: Wild Moments
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Wild Moments: Dangerous and Deadly II
programme.desc: Wildlife filmmakers often risk life and limb trying to capture unique images of their dangerous protagonists. A cunning grizzly grabs a salmon off Andreas Kielings fishing rod, in the depths of the Amazon River a diving team has a spooky encounter with piranhas, in the Mediterranean Sea the currents nearly push Thomas Behrend into the mouths of angry sperm whales defending a newborn - and cameramen who want to film jaguars in the dense jungle of South America become easy prey for the well camouflaged cats. The life of the film-makers is also threatened by elemental forces and failing technical equipment: In the swamps of North Australia violent storms hold up the crossing of tearing...

programme.title: Wild Moments
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 Wild Moments: Dangerous and Deadly III
programme.desc: Wildlife filmmakers often risk life and limb trying to capture unique images of their dangerous protagonists. In the Kruger National Park Josef Jozefowicz steps into a lionesses den to film her cubs, in Alaska Andreas Kieling mingles with giant elk bulls in order to film them in action, and in Florida his colleague Zoltan Torok gets very close to an alligator mother guarding its nest. The life of the film-makers is also threatened by elemental forces, and failing technical equipment: the strong and tearing current of the Yukon River throws Andreas Kielings boat onto a gravel bank, in the Democratic Republik of Congo camerawoman Heike Grebe is separated from her colleagues in the dense...

programme.title: Penguin City - South Georgia
programme.desc: In the middle of the Antarctic Ocean, an entire mountain range arises from the water: South Georgia, the nursery of the Antarctic. Hundreds of thousands of penguins, elephant seals, fur seals and their young overcrowd the beaches. The rough weather and the extremely difficult access to the island cause filmmaking to be an endeavor requiring much of the film crew around Roland Gockel and Rosie Koch and the state of the art cameras. A lot of patience and sensitivity over a period spanning some five years now offers unknown and poignant insights into the life of the King Penguins on South Georgia Island

programme.title: Project Antarctica
programme.desc: Why dont you do something sensible? - Tim, Michael and Dennis have heard this sentence more than once since their school days when they professed their dream jobs: Artist, photographer, filmmaker. And they went on to say that some dreams had to remain dreams, that work didnt have to be fun, but above all that it had to pay enough and be safe. A few years later, the three are working on their joint feature film. They put all their eggs in one basket and are determined to invest two years of working time to achieve their goal. Unpaid. Its not just any goal: the three want to travel to Antarctica. They want to find out whether it is possible to reach even the most distant destinations if...

programme.title: Antarctica - Tales from the End of the World
programme.desc: The Antarctic region is undoubtedly one of the most remote and inhospitable, yet one of the most beautiful landscapes of the world. This documentary takes us on a journey to the stormy isolated islands of the Southern Ocean. Seals, penguins, seabirds and numerous other animals live and breed in this hostile environment and harsh climate. Only by an icebreaker can we reach the remote coasts of the Antarctic continent where Emperor Penguins defy the life-threatening environment of the vast ice desert at the end of the world.

programme.title: Wildlife Diaries Australia
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Of Flying Foxes and Heat Waves
programme.desc: While the Tolga Bat Hospital is looking after endangered flying foxes, researchers are using thermographic cameras to search for flying foxes and koalas. But they can also detect bush and wildfire more quickly.

programme.title: Wildlife Diaries Australia
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Of Sea Turtles and Coral Reefs
programme.desc: The Cairns Turtle Rehabilitation Center (CTRC) raises and cares for sick, or injured turtles, while the Schmidt Ocean Institute goes on a diving mission with a high-tech underwater rover. In this way, we learn firsthand about the state of Australias sensitive marine animals natural habitat and what needs to be done to ensure their survival.

programme.title: Wildlife Diaries Australia
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Of Wombats and Vaccines
programme.desc: Tasmanias Bonorong Wildlife Sanctuary used to be a traditional wildlife park - now it is an innovative and active wildlife sanctuary and home to the famous Tasmanian Devil, to wombats, and many other native species. But unfortunately, "Tassie Devils" are particularly endangered by the Devil Facial Tumor Disease (DFTD). We accompany the team of young, ambitious scientists on their fight against the disease.

programme.title: Wildlife Diaries Australia
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 Of Koalas and Drones
programme.desc: Lone Pine Koala Sanctuary was opened in 1927 at a time when Koalas were still being killed on a large scale for the fur trade. Today, hardly anything threatens the natural habitats of these animals as much as the desertification of the forests. We let the drones fly and are there when a new tree is planted.

programme.title: Wildlife Diaries Australia
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 wOf Kangaroos and Conservation
programme.desc: Visiting the fenced nature reserve Arid Recovery in southern Australia, we witness the care of an injured kangaroo and follow researchers at the Hidden Vale Wildlife Centre near Brisbane as they train native animals to detect tracks of threatening predators and then move to safety.

programme.title: Wildlife Diaries Australia
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 Of Fairy Penguins and GPS Trackers
programme.desc: Australias largest fur seal colony is located on Phillip Island. Night after night, a breathtaking spectacle takes place here: At sunset, countless fairy penguins return from their hunt for fish. In the station near the penguin colony, pioneering scientific research is conducted around the cute animals. We learn how dedicated scientists are trying to secure the future of the fairy penguins with the help of GPS trackers.

programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Of Flying Foxes and Heat Waves

programme.title: Italy My Love
programme.desc: In ten coastal areas of Italy, we encounter people that have a very special relationship with their region. All of them love their country, their traditions and their work. We met with enthusiasts and hedonists that permitted us to take a glimpse into their everyday lives. Young Italians, who have rediscovered nature and its treasures. Others, that preserve the beauty, archaeologists that apply whole new methods, farmers that only cultivate that which the soil needs. Fishermen, who fish in the same way as it was done a century ago and tough, young men who play and dance the Tarantella. Dolphins, giant sea turtles and pink flamingos, which are researched, nursed back to health or simply...

programme.title: Wild Sardinia
programme.desc: Sardinia has always been the epitome of pure wilderness, an emerald of volcanic origin in the Mediterranean. 1900 metres of coastline and an infinite maze of offshore islands. But Sardinia also has other facets: green valleys, rugged mountains, murmuring brooks, mysterious ruins and a unique fauna. Just off of Sardinias coast is an untouched underwater paradise - uniquely beautiful, but also dangerous. Pilot whales, dolphins and mobula rays populate the waters at Capo Testa in the north of the island. In the west, the lagoons of Cabras represent a wild landscape of lakes in which thousands of flamingos live and hunt the red brine shrimps. In addition to the flamingos, grey and purple...

programme.desc: Dylan pidatetaan diktaattorin salamurhasta 300 vuotta sitten.

programme.desc: Dylan ja pastori Bem auttavat rauhanomaista yhteiskuntaa vastustamaan mahdollisia orjakauppiaita, mutta heidan on oltava varovaisia.

programme.desc: Mitch and Alex protect an orangutan, while Cody and Jessie deal with its abusive owner.

programme.desc: On the run in the wilderness, Travis and Aimee navigate icy waters and the secrets they keep.

programme.title: The Boatman
programme.desc: A dedicated border coyote is haunted by the memories of those he failed to help.

programme.title: When We Last Spoke
programme.desc: Two abandoned sisters live with their grandparents in Texas in 1967.

programme.title: The Ribbon
programme.desc: Molly and Tim are happy newlyweds, but an unexpected miscarriage threatens to tear them apart until they meet Kristin, a pregnant homeless girl in need of a family.

programme.title: Bright Sky
programme.desc: A single mother escapes a dark past to a small town. As she begins to build a new life, she comes across an outlaw looking for redemption.

programme.title: The Surrogate
programme.desc: The Surrogate is a contemporary dramedy about a group of Bay Area friends in their early 40s navigating lifes messy moments together.

programme.title: Gold Fools
programme.desc: When a successful family man gets laid off, he leads his friends on a gold panning expedition in the mountains of Sonora, oblivious to what lurks where the water runs real deep.

programme.title: TangerineLAnd
programme.desc: Beth Harris is getting married. The only problem is, she already has a husband; pro-surfer, Sonny Baker.

programme.title: Vincents Vow
programme.desc: A broken 30-year-old man who struggles with commitment, accepts a challenge to "learn what love is before claiming to love someone". The results are certainly not what hed expect.

programme.title: 2 Weeks in Lagos
programme.desc: The film captures the excitement and vibrancy of everyday life in Lagos and reflects the complexity of life in Lagos, a dynamic city where anything is possible in 2 Weeks.

programme.title: Alan and the Fullness of Time
programme.desc: The action-packed story of a boy who receives a calling from God that places him in the crosshairs of those in the government who do not want to see him succeed.

programme.title: Alan and the Rulers of the Air
programme.desc: Alan, a young teen with a calling to help complete the Great Commission finds himself embroiled in courtroom drama and demonic oppression.

programme.title: Harbinger
programme.desc: This fantasy/eco-thriller follows twelve-year-old Mira Gonzaga who has been having terrible dreams.

programme.title: Psychos
programme.desc: Three young women seek revenge against a sadistic predator.

programme.title: Operation Repo: The Movie
programme.desc: Lous daughter is kidnapped by a crazed drug dealer after the crew repossesses his car.

programme.title: Breaking Barbi
programme.desc: A Tinder date gone astray leaves famous fitness selfie queen, Barbi, lost in the wilderness trying to survive despite Homeland Security, alien death rays and zero cell service.

programme.title: I Remember You
programme.desc: Two strangers feel a supernatural connection after being involved in the same accident.

programme.title: Black Marigolds
programme.desc: Writer Ryan Cole and his Wife Kate go to an off season vacation house where he intends to finish his second novel. But their plans are changed by a devastating mental illness.

programme.title: Treasure Lies
programme.desc: Hardworking teenager Sean feels let down by life, but faces a crisis of character through a series of his own bad decisions.

programme.title: God and Salsa
programme.desc: A grief-stricken therapist determined to help a suicidal teen regains her faith in the process with the help of her Pastor and Salsa instructor.

programme.title: Who Will Move The Stone
programme.desc: A worldly Detroit lawyer decides to represent a Born Again Christian on trial for the murder of a Catholic Priest.

programme.title: Lucky Louie
programme.desc: A retired cop teams up with four ex-convicts and a behavioral science student to solve a fifty year old bank robbery in this new faith filled family comedy.

programme.title: Screened In
programme.desc: Peyton Hawthorne becomes disillusioned when she realizes her phone has taken over her life. She attempts to tackle her addiction but calamity ensues.

programme.title: In His Steps
programme.desc: When a homeless man interrupts the comfortable routine of First Church of Raymond, life will never be the same for the apathetic congregation.

programme.title: 6 Nonsmokers
programme.desc: Dr. Henry Caldwell, the world’s foremost mediator, faces the biggest challenge of his career when he takes on six roommates whose only thing in common is that none of them smoke.

programme.title: Beverly Hills Bandits
programme.desc: When bratty 5-year-old Byron Reed (Chris Williams) acts out the night before a family trip, his mother (Natasha Alam) makes him sit in the time out chair. When Byron awakens to an empty house, he assumes his wish to have no family has come true.

programme.title: Someone I Used to Know
programme.desc: An overweight man meets a former classmate on their high school track. As the two grow close and inspire each other, their pasts creep back into their lives and begin to threaten all that they have developed.

programme.title: Bittersweet Monday
programme.desc: An emotional goodbye between longtime best friends begins an unexpected love affair, putting two marriages and many friendships at stake.

programme.title: Twice
programme.desc: A mystery girl arrives in a small town in Brattleboro Vermont and creates a new life for herself while her past remains unknown.

programme.title: Broke
programme.desc: A disgraced sports star and gambling addict attempts to turn his life around with the support of his number one fan.

programme.title: Eight
programme.desc: A woman suffering from Obsessive Compulsive Disorder (OCD) struggles with her morning routine of trying to get to work on time.

programme.title: A Year And Change
programme.desc: After falling off the roof at a New Years Eve house party, Owen decides that its time to make some wholesale changes in his life.

programme.title: Arc: A Love Story
programme.desc: Lines are crossed and friendships tested when friends Ben and Naomi grow closer together amid a failed relationship and a broken marriage.

programme.title: Elephants
programme.desc: A true indie film through and through, Elephants takes an authentic look at a modern relationship in a "slice of life" style.

RAZOR will show you the worlds most powerful laser and the worlds smallest anti-cancer treatment. It will take you from the weird world of quantum computing to the boundaries of the cosmos. programme.desc: A suspect flees as officers respond to a fight call. A belligerent meth user refuses to cooperate after being pulled over. A cranky husband gets busted for pot after his wife kicks over his Harley.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Officers enlist the help of a K-9 unit after suspects in a dangerous high-speed chase abandon their car in a residential area. A woman with visible injuries tells the Officer that her husband assaulted her after they left a drive-in. A woman sprays her boyfriend with mace when she sees him with another woman.

programme.title: Cops
programme.sub-title: S24 : E17 Two Mr. Fix Its
programme.desc: A suspect attempts to flee when officers tell him they will search him. Two men get in a fight over window installation. A hotel room is filled like a clown car with multiple suspects.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Officers stop a man riding a bicycle in the middle of the street with no backlight. Suspects have a fun night out in a neighborhood known for drugs. Officers are dispatched to help a woman when her boyfriend threatens her with a brick.

programme.title: Cops
programme.sub-title: S21 : E06 The House Always Wins
programme.desc: A suspect runs from an illegal gambling game claiming shots were fired. A man is caught trespassing on school grounds. A male driver wearing a halter top is pulled over for a minor traffic violation.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A driver leads police on a slow speed chase towards Las Vegas. Three people are suspected of using contraband. A multi-neighbor dispute devolves into a fight involving guns and bats.

programme.title: Cops
programme.sub-title: S16 : E29 The Last Home Invasion
programme.desc: Police investigate an attempted robbery that turned deadly. Officers enlist a K9 unit to flush out a suspect. A high-speed chase comes to an end when the suspect crashes into a fence.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: At the conclusion of an extensive pursuit, the driver eventually loses control and runs into a stop sign. Officers stop a stolen vehicle leaving a known drug house.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A suspect bails out of his vehicle when a car chase reaches a dead-end. An officer responds to a domestic disturbance call and recommends that the quarreling couple get a divorce. Officers investigate a suspected drug transaction.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: An arrest is made in a notorious New Jersey drug hotbed. Officers find a suspect hidden under a mattress. A bicycle thief is caught red handed.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Officers search for suspects stealing rims at a car dealership. A married couple claim drugs found in their car were from a nearby ditch. Officers detain an inebriated man arguing with a store clerk.

programme.title: Cops
programme.sub-title: S26 : E11 This Man Stabbed Me
programme.desc: A car thief leads police on a high-speed chase until officers pit his vehicle to end the pursuit. Cops cool off a baby and search for the man who left him in a car. Potty-mouthed witnesses inform officers that their friend has been stabbed in the chest.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A woman bites the arresting officer and store manager after trying to steal beer. A passenger of a suspicious vehicle attempts to hide drugs. Police respond to a call involving a knife and two women.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Officers are called when a disturbed naked man covered in blood is spotted in a park. Officers find a nude couple in a U-Haul truck. A traffic stop over a minor violation turns into a dangerous pursuit.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A man who ran from police complains that he was not read his rights. Officers detain kids who threw rocks at windowfronts. A paranoid man claims he is being chased by drug dealers.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Officers are flagged down and alerted to a group of armed men assaulting people at a nearby home. A fight between a father and his adult son takes a dark turn. A father threatens his daughter and her boyfriend with a knife.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Undercover Vice Officers pose as drug dealers in an illegal drug transaction. A man is pulled over and arrested for driving a stolen vehicle. Three men are caught robbing a coin machine.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A bicyclist ends up on the pavement when he tries to out pedal a patrol car. A messy divorce leads to a gun-toting showdown between a Corvette and a Mustang. An angry dog ends up getting the best of a domestic dispute.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A jaywalker with no ID bolts away from an officer. A man mixes illicit items with his pizza. A woman involved in a domestic violence call blames her monthly issues.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A foot chase gets complicated when the suspect proves he’s not in good health. A suspect believes he doesn’t need to follow the rules of the road. A man calls the police on his ex-girlfriend when she makes a moving mistake.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: An inebriated man is arrested for peering through the window of a recovery center. After a foot chase, officers bring down a local felon. Police respond to a domestic dispute at a mobile home park.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A man on parole dumps a stolen car and flees from officers on foot. A man denies stealing a wallet from a car with a smashed window. A hostile woman gives officers a false name.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: An ex-felon threatens to kill his spouse after she announces she want to divorce him. A driver is stopped with suspicious plants in her car. A woman crashes her friends truck into a pedestrian and a tree.

programme.title: Cops
programme.sub-title: S22 : E16 Mean Girls Times Two
programme.desc: Deputies are forced to tase a man after pursuing him into a field. A driver plays dumb when asked about the revolver under his car seat. Officers respond to two teenage girls in a fight.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Officers conduct a sting using a decoy vehicle. A man with a knife flees the scene of a dispute with his baby mama. Deputies are dispatched when a man is assaulted with a shovel over twenty dollars.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Officers coax a man off a large construction crane. An inebriated man is jailed for domestic abuse. A man is rescued from a flash flood, but his truck isn’t so lucky.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Officers apprehend a man in possession of stolen property brandishing a rifle. Officers respond to a call of brothers in a fist fight. Police intervene when a couple argues in the middle of the street.

programme.sub-title: S27 : E33 Be Careful What You Ask For
programme.desc: An irate man begs the police to shoot him. A drunken woman gets nasty after being arrested for domestic assault. Cops wade through lies as they make sense of a most dysfunctional family.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Officers wrestle an uncooperative driver to the ground after a traffic stop. Deputies search for a man who sent threatening texts to his ex-girlfriend. Two suspects are caught stealing gas.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: An officer coordinates a reverse prostitution sting to capture suspects who solicit prostitutes. An inebriated man is detained until he sobers up. Officers stop a stolen vehicle.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Deputies pursue a man wanted in connection with a family violence call. Detectives are called to a dispute between neighbors over an unleashed dog. Officers stop a suspect and find paperwork containing dozens of others Social Security numbers.

programme.title: Cops

programme.desc: A sexually molested stepdaughter is suspected in the stabbing death of her father.

programme.desc: A teenage boy is the prime suspect in the murder of an older woman abusive husband.

programme.desc: Chance events trap hitch-hiker Al Roberts in a tightening net of film noir trouble.

programme.title: D.O.A.

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.desc: A pregnant woman is run down by teens out joyriding leaving Sgt Friday and his fellow officer Smith to track down those responsible. They find that kids are uncooperative, refusing to inform on their friends.

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.desc: Obscene literature and pictures are spread among youngster at a school in Los Angeles. The supplier of this illegal stuff turns out to be a former film producer from the days of silent movies.

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.sub-title: S03 : E17 The Big Little Jesus
programme.desc: Its Christmas Eve when Father Rojas at the Old Mission Plaza Church in Los Angeles discovers that the statue of the Infant Jesus is stolen from the crib. The statues worth is only a few dollars, but it is of great sentimental value for the parish. Friday and Smith promise to try to get it back before mass on Christmas Day, but this means that they have less than 24 hours to catch the thief.

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.desc: A man is found dead in the gutter. At first it seems as a hit-run case, but Friday and Smith become suspicious when all witnesses from the night before give exactly the same story. Usually witnesses are at variance in some respects.

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.desc: The detectives take a report of valuables stolen from the home of a somewhat eccentric old lady. They begin to suspect something is amiss when she starts talking about how she gets the "scoop" on crimes by being the first to report them to the local newspaper.

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.desc: A pregnant woman is run down by teens out joyriding leaving Sgt Friday and his fellow officer Smith to track down those responsible. They find that kids are uncooperative, refusing to inform on their friends.

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.desc: A truck kills an old lady and her little grandson at a crossing and drives away. The owner of the truck asserts that he let a man called Paul lend the truck for one hour, but he doesnt know the last name of this man or where he lives. The police must investigate all circumstances, but should Friday and Smith really spend lots of resources on trying to find a man they hardly believe exists at all?

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.desc: Friday, Smith respond to a bank robbery in progress. Car description, partial plate leaves many cars to check.

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.desc: When two four year old twin girls turn up missing, Sgt. Friday and Officer Smith are called in. The girls are found, but were molested. The officers continue to investigate until they locate the perpetrator.

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.sub-title: S03 : E31 The Big Hit-Run Killer
programme.desc: The detectives try to track down a tall, beautiful woman who has been terrorizing the city by robbing men, beating them up and in some cases shooting them. Their job is made more difficult by the fact that there are many inconsistencies in the victims reports.

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.desc: Friday and his partner Smith race against time to stop a series of brutal beatings of women in the Hollywood area. Just when they think they have their man, things change and very quickly.

programme.title: Dragnet
programme.desc: A holdup man is sticking up bars. After he takes the money he kills many of his victims. Sargeant Friday has few leads other than that the holdup man likes a certain song on the jukebox and likes to drink scotch and water.

programme.title: Renegade

programme.title: Renegade

programme.title: Renegade

programme.title: Renegade
programme.desc: Reno goes undercover to infiltrate a corrupt escort service in order to help Bobbys former fiancee.

programme.title: Renegade

programme.title: Renegade

programme.desc: Air Support helps find a suspect in connection to a donut shop shooting.

programme.title: Wiseguy
programme.desc: After Vinnie puts the Shakala Records investigation to rest, he and McPike take a trip to the mountains with Lifeguard, whose real-life problems may force him to quit the OCB.

programme.title: Wiseguy
programme.desc: After his mother is mugged in Brooklyn, an enraged Vinnie sets out to find the punk who did it, but when he visits his mother in the hospital, it breaks his heart that she still wont forgive him for his life of "crime".

programme.title: Wiseguy
programme.sub-title: S02 : E17 Hip Hop On The Gravy Train
programme.desc: Newquay tries to fire Vinnie, but Terranova responds with a restraining order. Newquay makes him the company mailboy to spite him. Vinnies associate Bobby Travis finds out hes a fed. With Travis help, Vinnie and Frank get incriminating evidence of Newquay committing fraud, and Frank arrests the mogul.

programme.title: Wiseguy
programme.sub-title: S03 : E02 Battle Of The Barge
programme.desc: When Cerrico and Tommy Chin tangle over rights to the carting business in Chinatown, Vinnie has to balance his undercover role as a mobster with his responsibiltiy to the OCB.

programme.title: Wiseguy
programme.sub-title: S03 : E16 A One Horse Town
programme.desc: Vinnie goes underground as a small-town deputy to root out the corruption in a company town run by one man�the reclusive Old Man Volchek.

programme.title: Wiseguy
programme.desc: Vinnie tells Mel Profitt he is leaving to go home to New Jersey, but Mel offers him the biggest cocaine distribution network in the country-- a plum that Vinnie feels is too juicy for any undercover cop to turn down.

programme.title: Wiseguy
programme.desc: Vinnie has no choice but to come out from behind his OCB badge to face the chilling accusations of mobster Sonny Steelgrave�the friend he was forced to betray.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.desc: McCann uncovers an extortion scheme while investigating toxic waste dumping near Carver High School.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.sub-title: S04 : E08 Stand By Your Man
programme.desc: While undercover as a medical student, Hoffs is raped by a fellow student but is reluctant to report the crime

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.sub-title: S05 : E15 In The Name Of Love
programme.desc: McCann is ordered to seduce the daughter of a prominent drug dealer to gather evidence against her father.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.desc: When the controversial host of a radio show is nearly killed, Booker takes over to flush out the guilty party.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.sub-title: S04 : E12 Things We Said Today
programme.desc: loki is held at gunpoint by a young man who turned in his family for drug abuse, blaming Harry for the outcome

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.desc: Hanson and Penhall head to El Salvador to find Penhalls missing wife and get caught in the local crossfire.

programme.title: 21 Jump Street
programme.desc: Hoffs joins a gang to solve a drive-by shooting.

programme.title: Hunter
programme.desc: Hunter and McCall pursue a convicted murderer who is free and has vowed to kill the jurors who convicted him.

programme.title: Hunter
programme.desc: A bounty hunter tracking two bank robbers crosses paths with Hunter and McCall.

programme.title: Hunter
programme.sub-title: S02 : E02 Night Of The Dragons
programme.desc: Hunter and McCall investigate a Chinese gang leader being pursued by a police officer with a personal interest

programme.title: Hunter
programme.desc: Hunter and McCall pursue a convicted murderer who is free and has vowed to kill the jurors who convicted him.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: On May 17th 2005, a body is discovered in a forest of Sucy-en-Brie; Christophe Belle, 40 years old, a renowned pastry cook.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: The disturbing missing case in Paris of a four year old.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: On October 13th 1996, the body of young Angelique Dumetz, 18 years old, is recovered down a ditch in Oise forest. An important clue is found on the crime scene.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: On February 23th 2017, policemen are alerted of the disapearrance of Brigitte Troadec, her husband Pascal, and their children Sebastien and Charlotte.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: A Night of Horror at Devils Plateau (Marie-Jeanne Meyer Case) - On June 18, 2011, Marie-Jeanne Meyer, 17-years old, waved goodbye to her little sister before leaving for her daily jog on the heights of Tournon in Ardèche. She never came back. Three days later, her mutilated body was found in a freshly dug pit, near an area known to be cursed, "The Devils Plateau." Whats more, the crime scene looked like a mystical ritual ... Was it a ritual murder? Revenge? An unfortunate encounter? ...

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: A Mysterious Murder at the Farm (Valerie Bary Case)- On Friday, March 26, 2004, in the region of Dijon, Laurent Bary came home from his work to discover the lifeless body of his wife, Valerie, bathing in a pool of blood. According to the investigators initial findings, the 38-year-old nurses aid had been stabbed several times, seeming to validate the theory of a robbery gone wrong.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: On July 13, 2011, two boaters retrieved a suitcase that was floating in the bay of Lorient. Inside, they discovered the tied up corpse of a man.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: Bloody Christmas next to the Leman lake (CASE OF RUTH LÉGERET) - On January 4, 2006, Ruth Legeret was found dead in the middle of a pool of blood at her luxurious property in Vevey, Switzerland. Next to her was the lifeless body of her friend, Marina Studer. Who could have killed these two simple and wealthy widows? Clue after clue, the Swiss polices investigation would revolve around an environment of family jealousy and financial greed.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: September 16 2005. The lifeless body of Audrey Jouannet, 24, is found hidden under the bed in her small apartment in Soisy-sur-Seine. It soon becomes apparent that the young woman has been tortured at length before being strangled. But surprisingly, though the highly meticulous murderer has taken care to leave no sign of his passage, the autopsy reveals traces of sperm on the victim. It will take all of the investigators intuition to pierce the mystery of this heinous crime...

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: Sylvain Dromard finds the body of his wife Laurence lying in a pool of blood in the kitchen. The crime was particularly violent and the theory of a burglary that went wrong is soon excluded. But investigators dont understand who could want the adorable hairdresser of Saint-Martin-dAblois dead. During the investigation, the work of profilers will enable them to draw a very precise portrait of the murderer...

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: After an ordinary dinner, Pierre and Gabrielle Labrell suffer severe abdominal pains.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: Nelly Cremel, 39, leaves her home to go jogging... never to return. Eight days later, after a vast search campaign, her body is found. Theres no doubt that its murder. The case soon ignites public opinion, even inflaming passions at the highest level of the state. The clues lead investigators on a number of trails, from the shadows of the French secret service to a manhunt for a possible sex maniac, in a case of murder most foul.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: Willy Pomonti, a retired architect, is found savagely murdered in his opulent villa in La Celle-Saint-Cloud, near Paris. It soon becomes clear that the man has been tortured prior to death. At several points during this extraordinary enquiry, police will feel theyre holding the culprit... It will take them ten years to finally shed light on this particularly violent crime.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: The lifeless body of Christophe Lejard is found by his son just metres from their home. The man was shot in the head as he was getting into his car to go to work. A veritable execution, which at first glance doesnt square with the profile of the quiet family man. Yet behind the appearances, the investigation gradually reveals all the hate and resentment that revolved around the victim.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: A man walks into a gendarmerie near Saint-Malo to report that his wife has been missing since the previous day. The couple are going through a divorce, but this mother would never have left her seven children alone! An extensive search is undertaken but the woman cannot be found. What has happened to Adeline Piet? The investigation spans several years and experiences many twists.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: The corpse of Priscillia Ciatti, 14, is discovered by the side of a field, a few hundred metres from her family home. The teenager has been stabbed sixty times with a knife and -an extra sordid detail - a devil mask is found next to her body. Was Priscillia the victim of a prowler? A serial killer? A maniac inspired by a horror movie? Investigators soon find that the young girl felt she was being watched, and even threatened...

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: In the early hours of the morning, Mathilde Croguennec, 18, attending "Teknival" in Brittany, is found at the foot of a tree with her throat cut. Investigators face the task of finding the killer from among the 43,000 participants of this huge open-air festival of electronic music, where drink and drugs are consumed in abundance. An unusual investigation that leads the police down a number of false avenues.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: Arriving at her work, the secretary of a small firm in the suburbs of Geneva finds the body of Jean-Raymond Blatti, the companys new accountant. The man is lying in a pool of blood and, on his belly, the murderer has written "DIRTY RAPIST". Yet Jean-Raymond Blatti was never charged with sexual assault. Over the course of the investigation, this inscription will appear as one of the many mysteries of this case which is particularly rich in twists and turns.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: On July 19th 2004, the naked and tied up body of a woman is recovered in the Ourcq canal in Fresnes-sur-Marne. The victim is impossible to identify.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: On April 3th 2003, Chantal Ternik, a 48 year old housewife, is discovered hanged in her house of Sanary-sur-Mer, in Var.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: On March 28th 2013, the burnt body of Anne Barbot, 38 years old, is discovered in a forest of Maine-et-Loire.

programme.title: The Last Persian Shah
programme.desc: Shah Mohammad Reza Pahlavi would have been 100 years in October 2019. The Shahs story begins with good ideas and ideals and ends in bloody chaos.

programme.title: The Vikings: Origin of the Vikings
programme.desc: From the ice fields of the North to the Russian steppe, these fearsome Scandinavian warriors sailed the globe for three centuries spreading their net of trade and pillage

programme.title: The Vikings: Early Viking Society and Religion
programme.desc: In this episode, we learn how early Viking society developed, what the sacred rituals really were, and what role women played in Viking religion.

programme.title: The Vikings: The Ships of the Vikings
programme.desc: Ships carried Nordic warriors all the way from their Scandinavian homes to lands of conquest. How were these ergonomic ships built and what made them so special?

programme.title: The Vikings: Weapons of the Vikings
programme.desc: The Vikings were fighting machines, plundering lands from central Asia to North America and defeated the armies of the greatest empires. What was their secret?

programme.title: JFK: Fact and Fable
programme.desc: Television made John Kennedy the ultimate celebrity during his presidency. However, the JFK we remember is the one his wife, Jackie, created after his death.

programme.title: Presidents In Crisis
programme.desc: Before they led America through national crises, Presidents Abraham Lincoln, Franklin Roosevelt and Lyndon Johnson were all transformed by personal trauma. Historian Doris Kearns Goodwin reveals the all too human men who became legends.

programme.title: The Hunt for the Slave Ship Guerrero
programme.desc: A team of underwater archeologists searches for the remains of the Guerrero, an illegal slave ship sunk in battle off the coast of Florida.

programme.title: MIA: Hunt for a WWII Plane
programme.desc: Ex-CIA agent Ben Smith and a retired FBI officer journey through the Jungles of Burma in search of answers to a family mystery.

programme.title: The Last Persian Shah
programme.desc: Shah Mohammad Reza Pahlavi would have been 100 years in October 2019. The Shahs story begins with good ideas and ideals and ends in bloody chaos.

programme.title: The Vikings: Origin of the Vikings
programme.desc: From the ice fields of the North to the Russian steppe, these fearsome Scandinavian warriors sailed the globe for three centuries spreading their net of trade and pillage

programme.title: The Vikings: Early Viking Society and Religion
programme.desc: In this episode, we learn how early Viking society developed, what the sacred rituals really were, and what role women played in Viking religion.

programme.title: The Vikings: The Ships of the Vikings
programme.desc: Ships carried Nordic warriors all the way from their Scandinavian homes to lands of conquest. How were these ergonomic ships built and what made them so special?

programme.title: The Vikings: Weapons of the Vikings
programme.desc: The Vikings were fighting machines, plundering lands from central Asia to North America and defeated the armies of the greatest empires. What was their secret?

programme.title: The Permian
programme.desc: Massive geologic changes allowed life to thrive on land and sea, producing saber-toothed carnivores like Gorgonopsid and the terrifying 40-foot shark Helicoprion.

programme.title: The Triassic
programme.desc: After the Permian period, the epic saga of evolution and extinction on Earth produced the worlds first dinosaurs, plesiosaurs and pterosaurs.

programme.title: The Cretaceous
programme.desc: Magnificent and terrifying dinosaurs like Triceratops and Tyrannosaurus ruled the land. But they were all wiped out in an instant by a collision with an asteroid!

programme.title: The Ordovician
programme.desc: For nearly 4 billion years, the continents of Earth were lifeless. But during the Ordovician, there was an explosion of life beneath the sea. Many creatures evolved.

programme.title: The Devonian
programme.desc: Life in the sea rebounded with a vengeance in the Devonian. Dozens of monstrous predators emerged, like the 40-foot long Dunkleosteus.

programme.title: Alien Life
programme.desc: Scientists investigate microbes found in Yellowstone National Parks thermal pools to understand the biology necessary for life at high temperatures.

programme.title: Frozen Archeology
programme.desc: There are places in Greater Yellowstone where the snow never melts, or at least, it never used to. Climate change is causing Yellowstone’s ice patches to recede.

programme.title: The Petrified Forest
programme.desc: Greater Yellowstone sits on top of a volcanic hot spot where devastating geological events unfolded. The result? A bizarre cemetery of fossilized forests.

programme.title: Mammoth Country
programme.desc: The Greater Yellowstone Area was once a rich grazing ground for huge Columbian mammoths. Now it’s a prime hunting ground for paleontologists and archaeologists.

programme.title: The Last Triceratops
programme.desc: Montana’s Hell Creek Formation is home to a trove of late Cretaceous fossils unlike any other in the world, revealing the last days of the great dinosaurs.

programme.title: Past and Future Yellowstone
programme.desc: Craters of the Moon National Monument is desolate – but 2,200 years ago, it was the site of today’s Yellowstone Hotspot, known for violent eruptions and huge craters.

programme.title: Worlds Best Dinosaur Fossil
programme.desc: An extraordinary new discovery of a dinosaur fossil so pristine and complete, that it shows off the texture, patterns, and color of a prehistoric giant. Discover this brand new species that roamed during the late Jurassic and Cretaceous periods.

programme.title: T-Rex Timeline
programme.desc: The Tyrannosaurus Rex is known as the king of the dinosaurs, but how did its reign begin? Meet Moros Intrepidus, a 180 lb., deer-sized ancestor to the T-Rex.

programme.title: Raising Dinos From The Dead
programme.desc: Could a 75 million-year-old dinosaur skull that has been sitting in a museum for over 20 years hold the first-ever dinosaur DNA discovered by humans?

programme.title: Saber-Tooth Brawl
programme.desc: Long ago, Saber-tooth cats ruled over the Americas. Fossil evidence is shinning new light on the violent lives of these mysterious species.

programme.title: Tastes Like T-Rex
programme.desc: Modern birds are the most direct descendants of some of the most iconic dinosaurs to ever walk this planet. But can science really enable us to alter chicken embryos to resemble their mightiest ancestor: T-Rex?

programme.title: The Rise and Fall Of T-Rex
programme.desc: T-rex - the "tyrant lizard king" - ruled the earth 65 million years ago. Today, he reigns as the ultimate predator and pop cultural icon.

programme.title: The Permian
programme.desc: Massive geologic changes allowed life to thrive on land and sea, producing saber-toothed carnivores like Gorgonopsid and the terrifying 40-foot shark Helicoprion.

programme.title: The Triassic
programme.desc: After the Permian period, the epic saga of evolution and extinction on Earth produced the worlds first dinosaurs, plesiosaurs and pterosaurs.

programme.title: The Cretaceous
programme.desc: Magnificent and terrifying dinosaurs like Triceratops and Tyrannosaurus ruled the land. But they were all wiped out in an instant by a collision with an asteroid!

programme.title: The Ordovician
programme.desc: For nearly 4 billion years, the continents of Earth were lifeless. But during the Ordovician, there was an explosion of life beneath the sea. Many creatures evolved.

programme.title: The Devonian
programme.desc: Life in the sea rebounded with a vengeance in the Devonian. Dozens of monstrous predators emerged, like the 40-foot long Dunkleosteus.

programme.title: Alien Life
programme.desc: Scientists investigate microbes found in Yellowstone National Parks thermal pools to understand the biology necessary for life at high temperatures.

programme.title: Frozen Archeology
programme.desc: There are places in Greater Yellowstone where the snow never melts, or at least, it never used to. Climate change is causing Yellowstone’s ice patches to recede.

programme.title: The Petrified Forest
programme.desc: Greater Yellowstone sits on top of a volcanic hot spot where devastating geological events unfolded. The result? A bizarre cemetery of fossilized forests.

programme.title: Mammoth Country
programme.desc: The Greater Yellowstone Area was once a rich grazing ground for huge Columbian mammoths. Now it’s a prime hunting ground for paleontologists and archaeologists.

programme.title: The Last Triceratops
programme.desc: Montana’s Hell Creek Formation is home to a trove of late Cretaceous fossils unlike any other in the world, revealing the last days of the great dinosaurs.

programme.title: Past and Future Yellowstone
programme.desc: Craters of the Moon National Monument is desolate – but 2,200 years ago, it was the site of today’s Yellowstone Hotspot, known for violent eruptions and huge craters.

programme.title: Worlds Best Dinosaur Fossil
programme.desc: An extraordinary new discovery of a dinosaur fossil so pristine and complete, that it shows off the texture, patterns, and color of a prehistoric giant. Discover this brand new species that roamed during the late Jurassic and Cretaceous periods.

programme.title: T-Rex Timeline
programme.desc: The Tyrannosaurus Rex is known as the king of the dinosaurs, but how did its reign begin? Meet Moros Intrepidus, a 180 lb., deer-sized ancestor to the T-Rex.

programme.title: Raising Dinos From The Dead
programme.desc: Could a 75 million-year-old dinosaur skull that has been sitting in a museum for over 20 years hold the first-ever dinosaur DNA discovered by humans?

programme.title: Saber-Tooth Brawl
programme.desc: Long ago, Saber-tooth cats ruled over the Americas. Fossil evidence is shinning new light on the violent lives of these mysterious species.

programme.title: Tastes Like T-Rex
programme.desc: Modern birds are the most direct descendants of some of the most iconic dinosaurs to ever walk this planet. But can science really enable us to alter chicken embryos to resemble their mightiest ancestor: T-Rex?

programme.title: The Rise and Fall Of T-Rex
programme.desc: T-rex - the "tyrant lizard king" - ruled the earth 65 million years ago. Today, he reigns as the ultimate predator and pop cultural icon.

programme.title: Transcontinental Railroad
programme.desc: The Americans who settled the west, those icons of freedom and independence, lived at the mercy of the railroad tycoons.

programme.title: Cold War
programme.desc: The Cold War was won not by weapons of war, but blue jeans, silk stockings, and fast food. Just follow the money.

programme.title: Civil War
programme.desc: Why, as a teenager in New Jersey in the 1980s, was Peter Sagal taught the Southern myth of the Civil War? Slaves = money = power.

programme.title: Watergate
programme.desc: Like a burger and fries, Nixon and scandal have always gone together. But why did his men break into the Watergate office building? Why did Nixon crave personal wealth?

programme.title: John Doy and the Immortal 10
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 Impossible Escapes: Civil War
programme.desc: John Doy is arrested along the Underground Railroad, but his friends are determined to set him free.

programme.title: Breaking out of Libby Prison
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Impossible Escapes: Civil War
programme.desc: A band of POWs held in the Confederate capital attempt the Civil War’s largest prison escape.

programme.title: Pauline Cushman: Tales of a Yankee Spy
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 Impossible Escapes: Civil War
programme.desc: When actress and Union spy Pauline Cushman is captured, her performance skills offer her a way out.

programme.title: Rebel Raid in Vermont
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Impossible Escapes: Civil War
programme.desc: Confederate raiders attack a small town in Vermont. A local posse tries to cut off their escape.

programme.title: Robert Smalls: Steamboat to Freedom
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 Impossible Escapes: Civil War
programme.desc: Robert Smalls is enslaved, but he has the skills and the nerve to sail a rebel ship to freedom.

programme.title: Into the Rebel Swamp
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Impossible Escapes: Civil War
programme.desc: Wallace Turnage was born a slave. He made multiple escape attempts. But on his sixth - and final - attempt, he endured a genuine odyssey.

programme.title: Blood Pattern Analysis
programme.desc: Can investigators decipher what happened at a crime scene based on the size and shape of bloodstains left behind? What can fluid dynamics tell us about the technique?

programme.title: Bite Mark Analysis
programme.desc: Bitemark Analysis appeared to fit neatly in the respected field of forensic dentistry until two researchers performed a bitemark study on cadavers.

programme.title: Firearm Examination
programme.desc: Firearms Analysis is one of the most relied upon forensic science methods in the US, but its foundational validity and reliability are now facing serious questions.

programme.title: Shaken Baby Syndrome
programme.desc: Shaken Baby Syndrome is a household name, but shockingly it may not be a valid diagnosis at all. New biomechanical research has changed the conversation.

programme.title: Footwear Analysis
programme.desc: Shoe prints seem like the most classic, helpful piece of evidence at a crime scene. But how does the science behind this comparison technique hold up?

programme.title: Arson Investigation
programme.desc: In just one generation Arson investigation changed from myth-based to a science-based discipline. What is the future for those still wrongly behind bars?

programme.title: Rats
programme.desc: New York is known as one of the rattiest cities in America with an estimated population of close to 2 million rodents. Here is how New York City rats out its rodents.

programme.title: Taxis
programme.desc: The yellow taxi cab is the quintessential New York City ride. But today the threat of ride-share apps and city scandal has left cab drivers to face devastating debt.

programme.title: Trash
programme.desc: Many things come to mind when thinking about New York, but how the city deals with its garbage is usually not one of them. Here is how the city hauls away its trash.

programme.title: Sewage
programme.desc: New Yorkers create, on average, 1.3 billion gallons of wastewater per day that makes its way through 7,500 miles of pipes that make up the citys sewer system.

programme.title: Steam
programme.desc: Many dont know it, but New York is a city that runs on steam. Its one of the few cities that relies on this old technology to heat some of its most famous buildings.

programme.title: Bridges
programme.desc: New York has some of the most iconic bridges. These engineering marvels have helped set the tone for how bridges around the world are designed.

programme.title: Parks
programme.desc: New York City might be known as the concrete jungle, but its nearly 30,000 acres of park space have been an ever-present part of this bustling metropolis.

programme.title: Airports
programme.desc: New York has one of the busiest airspaces in the world. Here is how New Yorks airports have evolved to handle 140 million passengers each year.

programme.title: Electricity
programme.desc: Keeping the lights on in New York City is no easy task and as New York moves towards a greener future how we generate electricity will have to evolve.

programme.title: Water
programme.desc: Getting water from upstate reservoirs to the taps of over 8.5 million people in New York City is no easy feat.
